greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k|n} binomial(n,k).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3329 (terms 1..500 from T. D. Noe)
Y. Puri and T. Ward, Arithmetic and growth of periodic orbits, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 4 (2001), #01.2.1.
formula: L.g.f.: A(x) = Sum_{n>=1} log( G(x^n,n) ) where G(x,n) = 1 + x*G(x,n)^n. L.g.f. A(x) satisfies: exp(A(x)) = g.f. of A110448. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Nov 10 2007
a(n) = Sum_{k=1..A000005(n)} A007318(n, A027750(k)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 13 2013
example: where the functions G(x,n) are g.f.s of well-known sequences:
mathematica: f[n_] := Sum[ Binomial[n, d], {d, Divisors@ n}]; Array[f, 37] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 23 2005 *)
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 25 2000
